articles.title: Coronavirus global death toll rises to more than 2,100
articles.description: At least 2,120 people are now dead from the novel coronavirus, with all but eight of those deaths in mainland China.
articles.content:
The steady departure of passengers from the stricken Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan is expected to continue today.

articles.title: Olympic legends discuss coronavirus threat to Tokyo 2020
articles.description: Questions continue to be asked about what impact the ongoing Coronavirus outbreak will have on this summer's Tokyo Olympics. Missy Franklin, Edwin Moses and Michael Johnson discuss how athlete preparations could be affected ahead of the Games.

articles.title: Grandmother describes life under lockdown with toddler
articles.description: Amid an unprecedented lockdown affecting 780 million people in China over the novel coronavirus outbreak, CNN's David Culver speaks with residents of Wuhan who are forbidden from leaving their homes.

articles.title: Novel coronavirus appears to be stabilizing in China amid fears of new outbreak
articles.description: Weeks into the novel coronavirus crisis, the outbreak finally appears to be stabilizing in central China, where the virus was initially detected before it spread throughout the country and the world.
articles.content:

articles.title: Markets were totally calm. Then stocks fell off a cliff
articles.description: It was shaping up to be a quiet day on Wall Street. Then around midday, stocks sold off sharply and investors scrambled. With no obvious catalyst triggering the selloff, worries about the coronavirus outbreak seemed to be the obvious suspect.

articles.title: Maersk operates massive container ships. It's canceled 50 sailings over coronavirus
articles.description: Maersk, the world's largest container shipping company, has warned of a "very weak" start to the year as the coronavirus keeps factories shuttered in China and dents demand for the transport of goods.
articles.content:
